document_data.first: [[Manual of the Planes 1st edition|''Manual of the Planes'' 1{{st}} ed.]]
document_data.text: Law, also known as order, is the force that gives structure and meaning to the multiverse. An innovation is nothing more than a new structure or form of order. That which stifles the creative spark does not serve law any more than bashing a mason with a brick serves to build a wall.
document_data.mainbody:
Archons were native to the House of the Triad, and most lived on Mount Celestia. Others lived in the realms of the Triad deities.

As the primary inhabitants of Mount Celestia, each archon had a specific role within a hierarchical system. There was no jealousy among the archons. Each archon was happy to perform its duties. Many lantern archons themselves are the [[petitioner]]s of lawful good deities.

The archons were led by the [[Celestial Hebdomad]], a ruling council of [[Celestial paragon|paragons]], which were all tome archons.

Many archons served [[the Triad]] gods [[Tyr]], [[Torm]], and [[Ilmater]]. The good deities [[Cyrrollalee]], [[Dugmaren Brightmantle]], [[Eilistraee]], [[Milil]], and [[Mystra]] all had [[lantern archon]]s in their service. [[Hound archon]]s served the [[halfling]] god [[Urogalan]]. Archons of all varieties were found in service to the good deities [[Arvoreen]], [[Berronar Truesilver]], and [[Deneir]].{{Cite web enhancement/Deity Do's and Don'ts|10-15}}

Types.[[Lantern archon]]: Friendly, curious archons that appeared as glowing balls of light. The lowest form of archon, sometimes called "proto-archons", these were the [[petitioner]]s of [[Celestia]] and the [[House of the Triad]].{{Fact}}
Types.[[Hound archon]]: Heavily muscled, disciplined soldiers that sometimes took the form of a wolf or dog on the [[Material Plane]]. These were the first "true" archons and served as soldiers and servants.
Types.[[Warden archon]]: These bear-like archons were the watchmen and observers of their plane.
Types.[[Sword archon]]: The sword archons led the hounds and the wardens.
Types.[[Throne archon]]: Throne archons ruled the settlements of Celestia, serving beneath the tomes.
Types.[[Tome archon]]:
The tomes were the strongest of the archons, whose greatest power was knowledge.

Archons whose position in the hierarchy was not clear to scholars include:
Types.[[Word archon]]: Archons who acted as guardians of pure concepts.
Types.[[Trumpet archon]]:
Winged archons who acted as messengers on the Material Plane for the throne and tome archons.

Archons who fell into the ways of chaos yet still remained good entities became [[asura]]s.

document_data.Abilities:
All archons could see in the dark and were immune to harm from electricity. They were resistant to poisons and could not be turned to stone by magical means.

An aura always surrounded an archon that protected it and anyone near it from the forces of evil. When an archon was angry or in combat, the righteous menace of the archon was so strong that it could be felt. They were innately aware of their surroundings when on their home plane.

Archons could [[Continual light|create a continuous source of light]]. They could [[teleport]] themselves at will. Archons were naturally fluent in the [[Celestial language]] and the [[Infernal language|language of devils]]. Most also spoke [[Draconic language|Draconic]]. However, they could communicate with almost any sentient creature using their innate magic, so in some sense, they could speak all languages.
document_data.Combat: When in combat, an archon courageously faced its foes head-on, unless it was obviously unwise to do so, in which case, they would take what opportunities they could to even the odds using hit-and-run tactics.
document_data.History: Between {{Yearlink|-247}} and {{Yearlink|-238}}, an army of archons, led by then-new deity Tyr, marched on [[Jhaamdath]] and defeated [[Valigan Thirdborn]].
